problem_statement: Raw load cell data is noisy and prone to thermal drift. A naive implementation simply calculates (CurrentRaw - InitialRaw) * CalibrationFactor. This fails in the real world because the

(Zero) changes throughout the day as rain falls or debris accumulates on the scale. The engineering solution requires Auto-Zero Tracking: a background process that slowly nudges the zero-point when the scale is
requires calculating the statistical variance of the signal stream
